item.title: Report X-2023120607
item.description:
Report X-2023120607

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered wet. It was immediately removed from the package flow and brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection discovered two cans of AutoBase plus MM Q140 deep black which are considered hazardous. The box for these items appeared to have been leaked on by another package. DescribePack: Both cans of AutoBase were dented, one had a slightly open lid with visible black paint along the rim. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed inside a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023121054
item.description:
Report X-2023121054

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: EVERETT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: BOX WAS UNLOADED FROM TRAILER PLACED IN AUTO BAY WERE IT WAS THEN NOTICED THAT THERE WAS A STRANGE SMELL AND A CORNER OF THE BOX APPEARED DAMP. IN HOUSE RESPONDER CALLED WHO EXAMIED THE PACKAGE AND FOUND THE CAP TO BE DEFECTIVE CAUSING A SMALL LEAK.
